DataElement.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Regional Lymph Node Metastasis Present Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The quantity of the existence of cancer that has spread from the lymph node, in which it first appeared, to another organ.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Regional Lymph Node Metastasis Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The existence of cancer that has spread from the lymph node, in which it first appeared, to another organ.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: A lymph node that drains lymph from a region of interest.:Cancer that has spread from the organ in which it first appeared to another organ. For example, breast cancer cells may spread (metastasize) to the lungs and cause the growth of a new tumor. When this happens, the disease is called metastatic breast cancer.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: A lymph node that drains lymph from a region of interest.

The spread or migration of cancer cells from one part of the body (the organ in which it first appeared) to another. The secondary tumor contains cells that are like those in the original (primary) tumor.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The quantity of the specified item.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: Determining the number or amount of something.
